review_title: Management is out of touch, morale is low since covid
job_title: Administrative Support Coordinator I in Fullerton, CA
pros: There are a lot of job opportunities on campus. I have held several roles since I started working at CSUF. The health benefits and retirement benefits are excellent. Work from home is allowed one day a week, in some departments.
cons: Morale was low before Covid and had only gotten worse once layoffs happened in 2020. We are overworked due to short staffing, and underpaid. Upper management has no clue how to boost morale, other than offering the equivalent of pizza parties to try to motivate their teams. There are no opportunities for raises. Anything more than a 7% pay increase requires the VP's signature. Office culture is stale and managers are poor communicators.

job_title: Adjunct Lecturer in Los Angeles, CA
pros: I enjoyed some of the chairs that I worked for during my 5 years of adjudicating for the history department. It is fine if you have a stable teaching job elsewhere and you just want to show up to teach and leave.
cons: This did not have a culture that encouraged lecturers to feel like an important part of the department. Lecturers rarely attended department meetings or worked with TT faculty on committees. Getting more courses or full-time status was very murky, though this is the case in many departments. It was never clear why new faculty were hired to teach new classes when existing faculty could teach them. Perhaps the strangest (and unjust) feature of the history department was /is the so-called K2 classes. These are classes with an enrollment of 115 students. If the class filled above 90 students, lecturers got paid for teaching two classes. If it fell below 90 (say 75) they were only paid for one class. So you could teach double the students for the compensation of a single class. It is hard to overstate how difficult this policy is for instructors.

review_title: slightly above average job, would rate 3.5 if I could
pros:
Great benefits, likely one of the best in the state
Calpers - pension/health retirement benefits 
strict 8am-5pm M-F work
Unionized and protected jobs 
Vesting at 10 years
Fun environment and energy with the students and events, especially during graduation
Boss/chair/dean/management usually change pretty quickly (3-10 years), if your boss sucks you have a 50/50 to hope for a better one in a few years. With vesting at 10 years, you likely will get another chance at a new manager by then.
If you stay long enough and start early enough, you might be able to get 100% pension of what you retire at.
cons:
Most are treated as just a warm, replaceable, body at a desk
Usually low pay
Unionized - because of being treated like another number and not recognized for work, many become jaded and do bare minimum on jobs. They will likely be like this until retirement. 
Low morale with many workers on campus
Management gets raises every single year and usually don't know what people even do, staff members who do the actual jobs never get a raise unless given by the union through contract negotiations.
Fake façade of diversity/equity/inclusion/insert buzz word here. Honestly, this place runs off of favoritism/who you know and not by merit/work ethic/years of experience/etc. Hired an older white male with no experience on campus for top tier pay because he was married to a former dean, counterparts who do same work paid way less, analysts above this position paid the same or LESS than this individual. This is one of many stories on campus. 
 No real training for jobs when hired and many staff members (again because of being jaded) do not want to assist new people on campus. Typical responses I've heard are "No one helped me when I first came on and I'm not either", "I don't get paid enough to do that".
Boss/chair/dean/management usually change pretty quickly (3-10 years), if your boss sucks you have a 50/50 to hope for a better one in a few years. You might get a worse one too.
If you are not a go-getter it will be hard for you to succeed since training is hard to come by and usually it is hard for people to figure out what their job even is because managers also don't know and definitely don't know how to train them. 
Very hard to get a raise without the union, most people need to move positions to get more money on campus and even then it's usually the bare minimum offered.
Yearly evaluations are rated at a 1-5 type category with 3 being "satisfactory". All management has been told that satisfactory means you are doing everything exactly as you should and have been told not to rate staff higher than that category, if they do they need to provide more information and fill out more paperwork as to why you are giving higher than a 3. This is because if you hit an overall category of 5 you can request a raise yourself and HR cannot deny the request; but it doesn't explain why management can't give a 4 because although you can initiate a raise request with an overall 4 rating, HR can deny those. This is another reason for low morale in the last few years since this change.

review_title: No Advancement Opportunities - Low Salary - Good Campus
pros:
* Nice campus with lots of new innovations. 
* Good insurance and retirement benefits. 
* Free education, free EV charging and monthly bookstore discounts for staff. 
* Annual university wide staff appreciation days and events.
cons:
1. There is a lack of work most of the time, except for the first two to three weeks at the beginning of each semester. If you want to be motivated, competitive, and appreciated for working extra hard, this is not the right place for you. If you enjoy working in a slow paced, repetitive, unchallenging work environment with no expectations to get higher pay nor advancements, this is the position for you. 

2. Lower pay compared to other colleges, universities and public sectors in SoCal. 

3. Most people stay until retirement. There is no cross-trainings for career development, so you will be stuck at the same position for a long time, unless you could move up to higher positions at a different department. You could also use current position and experience as stepping stones for better opportunities elsewhere.

4. Employees must pay for parking, and parking is a major problem.

review_title: Workplace Bullying by Horrible Management, No Pay Increase
pros:
(This review only pertains to the UEE division of CSUF)

Medical insurance benefit and co-workers in immediate work area -- because management is comprised of elitist bullies, employees tend to stick closely together in order to look out for each other
cons:
(This review only pertains to the UEE division of CSUF)

All levels of management, workplace harassment (a co-worker with stage 4 cancer was told by management that she didn't look "sick enough" for them to fully believe her diagnosis or to continue accommodating her limited schedule and workload -- she died less than a year later), ineffective union, low pay without possibility of an increase (no non-management employee within the entire organization had received a raise in the previous 7 years due to budget constraints, when they eventually did, it was a 1% increase), one year probationary period in which job training is extremely limited and asking questions is looked down upon by management

review_title: CSUF - Should I Stay or Should I Go? Think Twice
job_title: Administrative Assistant II in Fullerton, CA
pros:
The campus itself is a nice place to work. It offers the hustle and bustle of student life and has a lot of places to sit under trees to have lunch, etc. It may be okay to work here, if you are working and going to school at the same time, because of the convenience factor.

They also offer to pay the tuition, or at least most of it (if you want to go to school here) for I believe up to two classes (with a fee waiver) if you work here, (with permission from your boss, of course.)
cons:
The pay is on the low end of the scale: It is about 1/2 to 2/3 of what the corporate world offers for the same job title.

The staff is usually pretty good to work with but there are some management complaints.

There is little or no room for advancement.  

Parking is a nightmare on most days, even with a faculty/staff pass.

I have worked at the State level and in the private sector.  I have experienced the pay and atmosphere in the private sector to be the better choice.

review_title: Great job working professionally whole still in school.
pros: The environment is one that you're able to learn and grow in. You are working with your peers and gaining potential lifelong friends. You can seek guidance and work towards your personal goals for your career. There is flexibility for schedules given that it is a college position. You can get unexpected opportunities. You can utilize the equipment as needed for personal projects with permission!
cons: You're only allowed to work a certain number of hours is that is a problem for your finances. It doesn't pay as much as an off campus job would for doing the same position. It ends once you've graduated ( with a grace period I think )

pros: The international student administrators, staff and faculty have  wonderful attitudes and are very eager and willing to collaborate with new teachers. The students come from a range of different countries; in the past the majority of students came from China, but now the majority are from the Middle East.
cons: You only get paid for in class hours but are required to work office hours and after calculating all the lesson planning and office hours, I make less than minimum wage. The office places you in different classrooms routinely so that you can get a feel for teaching different subject, but that makes it more time consuming because you have so much more research and preparation to do for new classroom every session.

pros: I worked as an adjunct here for a semester.  I had a wonderful time.  The campus is nice and cheery, the students seem happy to be there and it was just a great experience.  My colleagues were outgoing and helpful.  Department chair was helpful, pleasant and the kind of boss you'd want to have.
cons: As an adjunct, you're not going to get rich.  It's also hard to find a full-time gig or adjunct with security of employment position here.  However, that's pretty much the case everywhere.

job_title: Instructor, College Or University in Fullerton, CA
pros: Considering its relative quality, Cal State Fullerton is a bargain, compared to many other colleges. It has some outstanding programs: music, dance, communication, accounting, psychology, and history.
cons: The pay is relatively low, even with lots of experience and a PhD. Even tenured or tenure-track faculty make a lot less than professors in the UC system, at USC, etc. do.

pros: Very exciting. Every day will be different requiring sufficient problem solving skills. Great position to have during school as they make a point to work around your class schedule. Also very flexible in terms of asking for time off. Mostly a fun and stress free environment.
cons:
The office is older and can feel cramped at times. 10 hour work days can also be draining. Although, a  normal part-time 20 hour week can be conveniently completed in two days.
Also, for all the lower positions, you must be a student to work there, resulting in a very high employee turnover rate.

pros:
Very flexible with changing schedules and taking hours off. 

It is great to work on campus if you are taking classes here because you can go between them so easily. 

There is also a current focus on making more opportunities for the student assistants and to make them feel more important.
cons: My current workplace has a very toxic member at a high position. This member gets away with never doing their job and they harass other workers. This member has clashed with student assistants many times. Nothing is done about this and it feels pointless to try and get things done about it. I'm not sure if this kind of thing persists throughout all workplaces on campus, but it is notable.

review_title: near volunteer-level, EXTREME working hours conditions at the bottom here
pros: The students are wonderful!  A lot of time off per year gives balance to EXTREME working hours and conditions during the semester.  Everyone that I'm immediately in contact with -- working with is wonderful -- great people.
cons: Upper executive management compensation is excessive while adjunct faculty salaries are far from competitive.  A math tutor earning $20 per hour is better compensated (on an hourly basis) than what I'm paid to teach engineering courses (considering all of the hours outside of the classroom necessary to do a good job).

review_title: Overall Good Experience - Limited Opportunities for Growth
job_title: Administrative Support Coordinator in Fullerton, CA
pros:
Nice amount of vacation and sick days. 
Health related and retirement benefits are decent.
cons:
Compensation for staff is very low and annual raises are sad. 
Policies are constantly changing.
Work processes move extremely slow in the Cal State System.

pros: You are working to help further the prosperity of students who are looking to get a great education. The departments offer a variety of opportunities for the students and aim to continue with great education.
cons: The turnover is high in some departments, the leadership is lacking and the amount of red tape you need to get through to get something done is pretty significant. There is also a great deal of employees who lack work and sit around doing nothing most of the day, while other employees are swamped and can barely get their head above water.

review_title: I am a supplemental instruction leader for history courses
job_title: Supplemental Instruction Leader in Fullerton, CA
pros: Great work environment.  Management cares about our success and the job is rewarding.  Friendly co-workers and neat, clean work area.  Fair pay considering the job responsibilities.
cons: If anything, I would say it would be nice to be able to work more hours sometimes.  Some professors don't take us seriously and try to avoid meeting with us SI leaders, which is an issue because those meetings are such a crucial part of our job.

pros: Enjoy working with students.  Have to take locals who are not motivated but several of the students from outside the geographical "must take" them are seeking education, not just a place to be for 4 years.  Those are a joy.
cons: Big bureaucracy, Heavy with support staff that make it difficult to get much support.  "Smart" classrooms that are not "smart", but somewhat automated.

review_title: Great work environment, great colleagues, mediocre compensation
job_title: Associate Professor, College of Business in Fullerton, CA
pros: Very supportive and collegial environment. Most employees seem to enjoy their jobs and the University, and actively work to ensure that others do as well.
cons: Low pay for faculty compared to comparable universities in other states. Very large and sometimes bureaucratic governance. Most faculty and staff are unionized, resulting in little opportunity for merit pay or bonuses, one-size-fits-all compensation structures, and very long and drawn out salary and benefits negotiations (often takes several years of negotiations for each raise).

pros: Pension is great - 5 years and you're vested. Benefits are awesome. Union is decent
cons: Major politics on campus. No one wants to give raises. Staff is under appreciated and overworked. Little to no flexibility in regards to work hours. There are a lot of micromanagers throughout campus - Beware! Union blocks bad employees from getting fired.

pros: Good benefits and bureaucratic paperwork not excessive like at some schools. Relatively easy to navigate the campus/administration.
cons: Students are unprepared for college work and are not respected or challenged by most professors. When a professor does come along that expects them to come to class prepared and write above a 9th grade level, they are shocked to hear that their skills are below average. The department chair of my department cared more about high enrollments and positive evals than about education. She suggested I teach a comic book version of Othello to students rather than the actual play because "they won't be able to understand" the original.

pros: Easy to work with, and supportive faculty! You will typically work with your specific department most of the time, making your experience very personal and enjoyable as you get accustomed to one another.
cons: Some of the automation in regards to documents and information transferring between levels of faculty is a little slow/cluttered. Expect delays when you first begin. It is difficult to get to know the other faculty since the school is so large.

pros: Friendly staff (and felt supported!!), my department genuinely cared about the wellbeing of the students, comparable pay for adjunct, decent facilities, I was able to share an actual office rather than a cubical (it's the small things), the department manager I worked with in the CAS department was absolutely amazing (she has retired), *most of the students seem to want to learn
cons: Unless you are teaching a very early or late class, parking stinks. Teachers should be compensated more when they are also responsible for labs

review_title: Avoid Positions in the Admissions and Records Department!
pros: Is a great place to work but working in Admissions and Records may prove detrimental to a budding career. Great benefits that also include financial assistance to complete degree programs and other continuing education.
cons: Admission and Records: Lower pay than the community colleges. Too much bureaucracy and questionable HR practices. Morale is extremely low and open communication is not welcome. No room for growth or advancement.

pros: They're really nice here and you're always allowed to ask questions if you're unsure about something. Training for this position is extensive and takes time, but they really want you to be confident in what you're doing when you're on the job.
cons: Work life balance may be hard to achieve but it's do-able. They do not pay enough for the work that they ask you to do here, other than that it's not so bad.

job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in Fullerton, CA
pros: Flexible schedule, good pay, safe environment, wonderful staff, great students, good work/life balance. Generally a great place to work.
cons: A lot of politics within the departments. They care too much about GRE scores when determining who gets TA positions, when that test is not really a true measurement of someone's intelligence.

review_title: Great students and good coworkers, but very little support for adjunct faculty
pros:
Good hours if you have kids in school
Good hourly rate of pay
Great atmosphere
Good students
Good coworkers
cons:
Very little advancement opportunities for adjunct instructors
No benefits
No job security
Curriculum was "DIY" with very little support or direction from above
Adjunct teachers do the majority of the work for little pay and benefits
The system is set up to take advantage of the "drones", the part-time teachers who chase the carrot of potential full-time work that the state can't afford to hire full-time.

pros:
- high pay rate
- Top heavy - lots of managers and middle management
- All members are unionized that help with manager conflicts
cons:
- Office politics is tough to navigate if you don't have someone to show you the ropes.
- things changes so quickly without proper assessment 
- Too business focused and not enough focus on serving students

pros: There are many different employment opportunities for college students, graduates, non-graduates etc... admin positions, employees of tsu, bookstore, professors etc.  Known and reputable university.
cons: Sometimes may have to park far from work site as it is on the campus and there are only parking lots around the university.

pros: Fantastic experience, a lot of self development, strong team, very rewarding. This was one of the most impactful jobs I have ever had and I would recommend it to any student.  Everyone on staff is great.
cons: Most decisions are top down, RAs don't have a lot of power in changes. There is increasing red tape.

review_title: Teaching Assistant for intro biology classes
job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in Fullerton, CA
pros: Great people. Getting to work with professors and students can really inspire you to do your best. It is also amazing getting to be part of research on a daily basis. The departments is adding more intro material for TAs. I think it will be extremely helpful for first timers, not so overwhelming.
cons: Pay for a TA is not great. I think if you are a regular employee the pay is much more acceptable.

review_title: Great job while working on Masters Degree
job_title: Graduate Student Assistant in Fullerton, CA
pros: Very flexible and willing to work with your schedule.  You are able to take some time off if you need extra time to study and understand your commitments as a student.
cons: While the job was great there were sometimes problems when prioritizing work and no clear deadlines or whose work to prioritize.

pros: Great supervisors. They really invested in your development and always had your back, Good learning experience. Made me a better student.
cons: Pay isn't great. You definitely aren't in a bargaining position, but I didn't really expect that from a job that you get while working towards your degree.

pros: This CSU is full of crap, lies, deception, and cover-ups!
cons: If you're an MPP, be prepared to be attacked personally and professionally. Management provides absolutely zero support and training for MPPs; therefore, MPPs are disposable every Friday. You do not serve at the pleasure of the President at any CSU, you serve at the pleasure of how well you can play the political game at how to keep your job or throwing someone else under the table to make yourself look good.

job_title: Lecturer-College of Education in Fullerton, CA
pros: Full - time Lecturers afforded a lot of the benefits of tenure track.  Lots of Autonomy
cons:
Cast system.  Full time lecturers with doctorate degrees denied input into governance.  Have limited access to  grants promotional opportunities.  Work harder for less pay.  Very difficult to move from lecturer to tenure-track.  Governance is secrete

No collaboration between falculty

pros: Management was awesome. The atmosphere was very laid back, and they were very understanding about my scheduling.
cons: This location was all the way back in the far corner of the campus, so I would have to drive across campus to get to work on time.

review_title: Good place to work part-time while completing your degree
job_title: Graduate Student Assistant in Fullerton, CA
pros:
It's on campus. 
Pay is good taking into consideration that you do not have to commute to a different location for your job.
Staff is great.
cons:
Chain of command could be more structured since not many staff realize how, why and what purpose this type of command serves.
Career opportunities are limited.
Nonexistent promotions even if employed here for decades unless you're well connected to higher management.

job_title: TA for Physics Department in Fullerton, CA
pros:
It is convenient schedule for also being a masters student.
Teaching can help you review introductory physics/astronomy topics.
I was pleasantly surprised that seeing students learn felt as rewarding people say it is.
cons: Sometimes grading is tedious (particularly for the astronomy lab). Pay could be a bit better compared to other schools (UCs for example), but CSU tuition is also less than a UC.

review_title: Easy job for college students. Lots of freedom, minimum wage.
job_title: Supplemental Instruction Leader in Fullerton, CA
pros: Lots of freedom. If you know the subject well and you’re nice to the students, students will be nice back.
cons: Minimum wage. Bad management. They train you for 2 days and then you’re on your own the whole semester. They don’t care about SI or SI seniors that much.

pros: If you are an exempt staff you will get flexible timing.  You get the independence to do whatever you want in you job.  Good landing job for beginners.  But if you stay too long you will not be able to move anywhere.  Most folks stay there because they are stuck.  Job security after you become permanent.
cons:
Poor salary.  They have not reviewed their salary range in years.  The benefits are pretty good.  But if you compare with outside salary it is nothing.    
Management is pretty bad.

pros: Everyone usually gets along well and are able to complete tasks necessary for work. The work may be hard at times but it is also satisfying.
cons: Upper management at CSUF is disconnected from what happens daily on campus and can make rash decisions sometimes.

pros: Learn hands-on knowledge about the data closets and data centers. Become familiar with CISCO commands and devices. Become familiar with Alcatel-Lucent commands and devices. Become familiar with Eaton UPS commands and devices. Be able to confidently activate switch ports for Ethernet jacks.
cons: A lot of heavy-lifting and getting dirty from dust. A lot of traveling to different closets and centers.

review_title: Adjunct does the work and pay does not cover gas
pros: Great university for some students. Certain departments are not as well organized. Fast and timely response from HR department.
cons: No prep time for adjuncts, little to no available space after your hour is up for the office.

job_title: Front Desk Student Assistant in Fullerton, CA
pros:
>Job security until graduation.
>Opportunity to meet students, professors, and administrators from around the world.
cons:
>Severely understaffed.
>Assistants will also work with sensitive administrative level information/projects that are not in the job description.

pros:
Excellent four-week training opportunity to assist you with transitioning into your college and handling your Retention Specialist duties.  
Great co-workers and upper management, and cohesion between campus members.
Excellent union-member benefits.
Would love to return to the University for work.
cons: None at all, CSU-Fullerton is an excellent work environment.

review_title: Teaching university offering no time for quality research
pros: Non-demanding publication quota for tenure if you can find the time or motivation to do any. Weather.
cons: Heavy 4/4 teaching load. Many demanding students who need their hands held and blame their teacher for everything. Teaching was often just going through the motions. Management who offer little support and only care about student evaluations rather than teaching quality No time for any substantial research.

review_title: Great environment with flexibility on learning subjects in computer science major which is my field of study
job_title: Software Development Engineer in Fullerton, CA
pros: Great student employee job opportunity available as software developer in IT department.
cons: In masters program in computer science departments, classes are packed and there are a long waiting lists to enroll

pros: The supervisors are always motivating and help grow your personality. If you ask good questions, you will be given a lot of resources and guidance to continue with your work.
cons: There are a lot of rules and procedures. It can be difficult to manage at the start but you would get used to it as you keep learning

job_title: Graduate Assistant and Analyst in Fullerton, CA
pros:
- Exposure to a variety of people from different cultures. Helps in building understanding and inculcating team work.
- Job nature is secure and one of the respectable ones on campus.
- Getting to learn a lot new about latest technologies, troubleshooting and testing.
cons: - Job nature is quite monotonous at times.

pros: I work as a student assistant so it is great due to it always being so close to me after classes. I am also able to get 20 hours a week and able to take some days off if I needed to study
cons: The wage here is minimum but other than that it is okay.

review_title: Student Assistant at California State University
job_title: Graduate Student Assistant in Fullerton, CA
pros:
Provides challenging web development work.
Learned live streaming using services such as Xsplit.
Got familiar with HTML5, CSS, PHP, and also CMS OmniUpdate Campus v10.
cons: Creating whole new website for the college of communications and then migrating it to newer version of OmniUpdate Campus v10 was a challenge.

review_title: Research Assistant for Professor in Computer Science Department
pros: Flexible hours to do research on my own or group. Fill in timesheet by myself and as long as the progress justifies the filled-in hours, it is all good.
cons: I guess it depends on who you work for. In my case, I didn't experience any real cons.

pros: For the most part, if you are a student, they respect your availability.
cons:
My department is filled with Politics and an Incompetant Director who is to afraid to be a leader.

Pay is not the best. But hey its a state job.

pros: The employers are not familiar with how to run a professional environment, therefore it is easy to get away with a lot. Also if you are a "favorite", you can do no wrong... but watch out because "favorites" are always rotating!
cons: Since the dismissal of the actual Director the center has been on a down hill spiral which one should not get involved in if success is your goal.

review_title: It was okay for a college job.
pros: The people/friends your'e able to make makes the job much easier.
cons: The pay as minimum wage; the people running it are idiots; some customers can very rude no matter how pleasant, and/or respectful you are towards them.

pros: It was really fun to work there while in school, it helped strengthen bonds with co-workers and professors. Overall, this was a really great experience
cons: No say in teaching schedule or compensation. Course schedule can be very last minute. This can be expected for part-time/adjunct faculty

pros: I worked in the research wing of SSRC and it was pretty good. No perks as such it was a student assistant role but they paid minimum wage
cons: No benefits and poor management team. Most of them were student assistants anyway

review_title: fun and easy workload, caring supervisor
pros:
-$11-12 as graduate assistants to assistant dean of student affairs
-mostly supervising center, administrative work, helping students, and tasks supervisor assigns
-when it's slow, you can do your hw (basically getting paid to do hw or be on the computer)
cons: i didn't experience anything negative

pros: My supervisor was really helpful in helping me learn my position, they are flexible with work hours because they know we are students, we do team activities and the whole team is very nice.
cons: Sometimes it was slow, work wise.

pros: Great Environment, Interesting tasks, Helpful Adviser, Flexible Timings, Positive Environment
cons: There were nothing that i want to strictly mention as a Cons about this Job but yes, sometimes you need to wait a little bit longer to get approve your task from the department.

review_title: Finance, Economics, & ISDS Tutor at the Irvine Campus
pros:
Flexible Hours
Good relations with students
Excellent supervisor
Beautiful tutoring center
cons: None, everything about working there was great.

pros: Very flexible schedule, best boss ever, fun and relaxed environment and coworkers, creative freedom, great place to learn for students.
cons: Only available to enrolled CSULB students (it's expected you'll get a job after graduating and leave anyway). Also a low/starting pay because it's entry level.

pros: The school provides flexible hours and coworkers and staff are friendly.  You are often able to take time off to study for hours.
cons: There is very little growth as a student worker.  Depending on the department, you are also expendable and easily replaced.

job_title: Graduate Teaching Associate in Fullerton, CA
pros: Freshmen classes, two at the most, light workload, choose office hours
cons: You can only teach two classes max, which equals 20 hours per week, the pay is stable but does not increase.

review_title: Awesome...depending on what department you get to work with
pros: great benefits that are the best from the government paid system.
cons: hard to get in through the department that hires because they don't want to hire minorities or new grads.

job_title: Technical Student Assistant in Fullerton, CA
pros: Good working professionals, very understandable and communicate, association is very helpful.
cons: Can get a good balance between life and work. People are very generous and helpful. Got opportunity to learn and grow.

review_title: Stable Job, not much to challenge you
cons:
Less chances for getting promoted;
People who joined the staff many years ago are still working there;

job_title: Adjunct Instructor in Ladera Ranch, CA
pros: Great Communications department; current Chair is fair, diplomatic and straightforward. The students are engaged and it has been a pleasure to teach there.
cons: Similar to many schools, there is no job security as an adjunct.

review_title: CSU Fullerton was a great place to work
pros:
Same place as school.
Peers are usually about your age.
Easy to find a job that is major related. 
Pays well.
cons:
Your job being the same place as school might make life monotonous.
Typical college jobs.

pros: what i like about working at csuf is that it offers opportunities to grow as a student. I work part time as a tutor. i enjoy helping others achieving their academic goals.
cons: small compensation and complicated bureaucracy.

pros: Some of the pros of working as a student assistant at CSUF include flexible schedules, good pay while going to college, and being able to work on campus.
cons: No cons. Perfect campus job.

pros: Good to work as a Student Assistant on campus. Your experience depends on nature of your work. Everyone all around the university treats students so well.
cons: I dont really see any negatives.

review_title: Great Option for Students Needing a Job
pros:
Extremely convenient for students.
Flexible scheduling that works with your classes.
10% discount on Titan Shops with employee discount card.
cons:
Not many hours.
No opportunity for career growth. 
Mostly just a temporary job while at school.

review_title: Worked here for more than 22 years and love it to this day!
pros:
Love working with the student.  
Always something new.
cons: Not many issues to report.

pros: Awesome place to work! Very diverse student population so I feel like I am really making a difference in helping people that work so hard and deserve it.
cons: Some politics - as with any educational institution.

pros:
Decent pay for work depending on requirements of the course.
Pick and choose times that work for you, make your own office hours.
cons: No tuition benefits for being a TA while attending school

review_title: Good place to work as a Student.
pros: You get learn new things while working with diverse community.
cons: There are no downsides, you should work where you fall with your interest of work.

job_title: IT Student Assistant in Fullerton, CA
pros: Flexible schedule, on campus, some time to study, free food, drive golf cart around campus
cons: Minimum wage, more technical position compared to other student assistant jobs, high responsibility, physical labor, dirty conditions at times

pros: The benefits are great and the CSU is like one big team. They also have excellent work/life balance.
cons: The pay is not that great honestly. Most staff are overworked and underpaid

review_title: Working at ATC Department was Fun and I am satisfied
job_title: Graduate Tech Assistant in Fullerton, CA
pros:
management
friendly co-workers
will get to learn on many tools and tech
platform to improve communication skills
cons: no well defined process in place

pros: work culture, compensation, colleges, company values, perks, promotions all the things mentioned are goood
cons: night shifts, timings, workl ife balance. crazy shifts and timings and because of that there is no proper work life balance

pros: Create strong friendships and connect with people you might have missed out on, otherwise!
cons: Blessing in disguise: Students who work for the university tend to have higher grades than other students.

review_title: Good for Freshman & Straight out of HS
pros:
Good for inexperienced 19 year olds to get some experience
Easy peezy interview
Job is also super simple
cons:
Pay is super low
Work is very boring
No room for career growth

pros: Great Place to Work For. There is a sense of community, people who care about the students and the well-being of the employees
cons: No in range progressions. Budget is always very small.

review_title: Work environment is good, people are very co-operative and helpful
job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Fullerton, CA
pros: Good team, good people, good exposure and recognition
cons: Favoritism, pay is not that great compared to other dept on campus

job_title: Student Services Professional III in Tustin, CA
pros:
+ great benefits package
+ great on-campus gym available to staff (for a nominal fee)
+ excellent opportunity to impact student lives positively
+ competitive salary
cons: Parking, like at any campus, can be a challenge.

pros: Job has no stress and we nake good friends.... eco  friendly environment
cons: Salary seems to be less ... no possibility for researchers

pros: Fantastic environment in this department, wonderful people, great pay and benefits once full-time, great management/supervisors.
cons: There were really no cons for this position.

review_title: Great job great place to work
job_title: Multimedia Production Assistant in Fullerton, CA
pros: Lots of production editing is learned on the job.
cons: You must endure working with multiple professors which at times can be very hectic, especially if you are a student.

review_title: Excellent support and motivation for research
job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Fullerton, CA
pros: Good faculty, helpful and attentive. Highly motivating and ambitious and encouraging to aim for novel research.
cons: Sometimes it may take time and lengthy procedure to order stuff for research.

review_title: Good place for college part time
pros: Flexible scheduled based on class schedule. Weekly meetings to keep everyone on track.
cons: Don't really work with other SI instructors so it can feel kinda isolated. You versus the students.

review_title: Excellent place to work, nice environment.
pros: Nice environment, nice place and good and interesting work.
cons: That is on campus job. Better to do off campus job at company to have better experience.

review_title: Operations Analyst at Cal State Fullerton
pros:
great benefits, 
easy workload, the union for staff
cons: low salary, small-town politics, imbalanced sex ratio

pros: - Team based staff with understanding and supportive managers
cons: - Upper management had sometimes me work on projects, only to have me undo those projects a couple months down the line.

pros: flexible scheduling, ideal college job, work with other students, random perks
cons: no room for growth, minimum wage, taxed aggressively during certain seasons

pros: The students and some other professors.  Good benefits, good retirement, nice office.
cons: The pay is not high for lecturers (adjunct professors.)

review_title: Very positive. Professors and Coordinator were really helpful
job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in Fullerton, CA
pros: Space to grow as a teacher. Your opinions count
cons: Salary could be a little better considering the time involved before, during and after lectures

review_title: Great  place to work, friendly staff
pros:
My boss is really nice and thoughtful
Other student assistants are nice
cons: They pay the minimum wage

pros:
1. work environment is good.
2. convenient work timing.
3. No work Load
cons:
since there is not much of the work you will be bored.
Constant confusion between colliege.

pros: Location and weather are great.
cons: SoCal expense, traffic,  student body is lower tier and class sizes too great.

pros: Staff and Faculty are great to work with. Want to help you learn and help you pursue your dreams.
cons: During the semester you are capped 20 hours

job_title: IT Student Assistant in Irvine, CA
pros: Work on campus, meet cool people, plenty of time to work on homework and assignments
cons: Limited weekly hours (20 max per student during the semester)

pros: Working with different cultural backgrounds and something new every day.
cons: Management could use some training on business operations and management skills.

review_title: Depends which department you work for
pros: Great community of folks working to help students.
cons: Some departments can be resistant to change. Depending where you work some managers can be pretty toxic.

review_title: A great time working for the University!
pros: You're surrounded by like-minded people all the time!
cons: As a student assistant, room for growth is not really an option.

review_title: Squeeze as much work out of you for as little compensation as possible to line the pockets of upper management.
pros: Keeping pace with advances in teaching technology.  Students are great.
cons: Pay is not competitive at all.  Class rooms and labs are looking like a third world country.

job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in Fullerton, CA
pros: The task is not too challenging, you can set up your work time.
cons: schedule varies a lot. You may not have enough time for your finals.

job_title: Student Coordinator in Rancho Cucamonga, CA
pros: very flexibile and will work around your school schedule
cons: restricted to working less than 20 hours per week for a student position

job_title: Student Assistant in Garden Grove, CA
pros:
-Professional development
-Diversity training, cultural competency workshops 
-team building 
-program and event planning
-Supportive staff
cons:
-short hours
-no structure sometimes
-center had low traffic and turnout

review_title: Good first job for the industry
job_title: Information Technology Consultant in Fullerton, CA
pros: They are a very supportive group of individuals that help you build up your skills.
cons: Little to no room for advancement.

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Fullerton, CA
pros: Flexible, understanding, raise opportunities, first time job hire, great supervisors
cons: No benefits, irate customers, 20 hour maximum weeks, only students can apply/get hired

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Fullerton, CA
pros:
Loved attending conferences and writing papers;
Learnt a lot about Brain Computer Interface and Neuroscience
cons: Too short a period to complete research to my content

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Fullerton, LA
pros: Provding a lot of good reseach projects, and allowing me to learn various reseach skills
cons: it is not a long-term job.
